intro: Erigeron oolepis, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron oolepis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
